title: Logical Camera data does not include the time the data was generated

content.raw:
The logical camera has two interfaces for getting data: [LogicalCamera::Image()](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/f9d84fa63ffb0a6473e0c3142767e858f6766b9e/gazebo/sensors/LogicalCameraSensor.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#LogicalCameraSensor.hh-87) and a [gazebo transport topic](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/f9d84fa63ffb0a6473e0c3142767e858f6766b9e/gazebo/sensors/LogicalCameraSensor.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#LogicalCameraSensor.cc-83). Both of these methods offer an instance of [LogicalCameraImage.proto](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/f9d84fa63ffb0a6473e0c3142767e858f6766b9e/gazebo/msgs/logical_camera_image.proto?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default).

This message does not contain any time information. It is impossible to know the simulated time of when the logical camera sensor data was generated both as a sensor plugin and as a standalone program using gazebo transport. This would be a problem for a user who wants to do something with the poses where the sensor or models may be moving.
content.html:
The logical camera has two interfaces for getting data: LogicalCamera::Image() and a gazebo transport topic. Both of these methods offer an instance of LogicalCameraImage.proto.

This message does not contain any time information. It is impossible to know the simulated time of when the logical camera sensor data was generated both as a sensor plugin and as a standalone program using gazebo transport. This would be a problem for a user who wants to do something with the poses where the sensor or models may be moving.
